rComments: Not very helpful at all. Lecture slides of code were full of typos and he never sent out corrected versions to aid in coursework. Clearly does not have any passion for teaching. Average professor at best.

Class is extremely unforgiving for the mathematically uninclined as he likes to put confusing conceptual questions on exams. I did not understand his lectures; I relied on MSI and TA office hours to pass. Don't waste money on textbook.
Professor Spearot is an excellent teacher. I felt that his Econ rhetoric class has taught me a lot. Great clarity when he spoke. Very helpful whenever I asked questions. Highly recommend this class.

Professor Spearot does econometrics for a living so he knows what hes talking about. But he also doesnt explain the material to you like you also know. He is able to communicate clearly what he wants you to know. For the homework using stata, write down what he does in class and your good!
Spearot teaches this class with the expectation you learned something in AMS 5.  If you understand Stats, this class is cake.  If you don't, get extra help.

He definitely has the right enthusiasm for the subject, but his lectures don't enhance my understanding of the material. The practice tests and generous curve are extremely helpful. This was the most useless econ requirement that i've had to take so far.This classwasn't intellectually stimulating or rewarding.  Don't bother to purchase the book.

From the first day I attended class to the end of it, I didn't understand a thing that came from Spearot.  His lectures are not structured in a way that makes it easy for first timers of Econometrics (perhaps it's just the subject..).  I spent much my time studying for this class by searching for other people's lectures and that helped me pass.
He is extremely enthusiastic and passionate about the subject. If you attend lecture and go over the practice exams provided you will be fine. He will make this class more fun than you think.
113 is hard to teach and he makes it a lot more interesting. Such a nice guy if you get to know him, not to mention, really funny and incredibly cute!

This guy gives the most confusing and longest tests ever and he basically says "STUDY EVERY SINGLE DAMN THING we've learned and you'll do fine on the test." Then you sit down and take the test and are ****ed.. avoid this clown! Super hard.

One of the more better and interesting professors I've had in a while. Econometrics is a hard and boring subject but Spearot made it interesting. Attendance is not mandatory but I recommend going because it helps a lot. Make sure you study the lecture notes and old exams, they're very similar.

One of the better professors I've had for a quantative course; Econometrics is extremely dry, and he made a good effort towards making the experience enjoyable. His teaching was effective, and honestly if you didn't do well in his class its probably due to your own ability level or your lack of effort, not his.

Powerpoints suck b/c they are distracting and boring. He is tougher than Dobkin. Though I have to say, four midterms is ridiculous b/c you're afraid of swine flu (word: get vaccinated). Two midterms would have been just fine. He is good at explaining though. But he is hott and funny! =]

easily distracted. His mind is elsewhere. He thinks he is funny, but he is not. He spends at least 10 minutes messing around with the mic and 'joking' before he gets started. He lectures like a bad TA! I learned more about him and his ego than I did about econometrics. I got near perfect on all the exams, and left the class with an A-.

Anyone that give Spearot a bad rating is crazy. This guy is hilarious and you can tell he really tries to make the class fun and worth coming too. He has a midterm every 2 weeks which really isn't as bad as it sounds and it made the class easier. Homework was straight forward and final was nothing I didnt expect. Overall great professor

Humorous Way of teaching Econometrics. HW(s): CPU Codes, just takes a little bit of time (1-2 hour of hw) Midterms: There's always a tricky question. Studying the old midterms might not help that much. Go through HW and lecture slides when studying for midterms. Attendance: not required, but recommended because his lectures have ?s and no answers.

You must watch Big Lebowski. Most of his jokes are references. He forces you to attend lecture; you have no choice because of HORRIBLE text selection. If you must take him, study group is a must whereas sections are maltimed. He should publish hwk due dates at beginning of course, for the sake of busy bodies. I hope he is one day fired or improves.

Prof Spearot was a great teacher.  I'd rank him in my top 3 at UCSC.  I didn't do that well on the first test (C), but it got easier for me and I ended up with an A.  You need to go to class everyday to get the notes and better understand the material.
HORRIBLE CLASS AND TEACHER!! I did all my homeworks, went to MSI, went to office hours and went to every class and i still did not pass this class!!! This is the worst class ever.

SO happy I took 113 with him. Spearot made the material interesting and his lectures/ teaching style are clear and easy to follow. His powerpoints are thorough enough that the book isn't needed. He inspired me to minor in stats in addition to the economics major.

Excellent teacher...yes, there are some typos on the notes he gives out, but he gives you most of his notes...you need to go to class to fill in the blanks.  Going to class is important no matter what, just like going to work will be when you get out of school. He's very clear and if you don't understand he has no problem explaining.

Don't take this class if you like to miss class, but I am a nerd and go to every class so I got an A- without any effort other than attending class and doing homework. I did not go to any sections or office hours. The teacher is really funny and you will never be bored, also he doesn't require you to get the book so save some $ and take this class.
I would not recommend this teacher to anyone who plans on missing a single class, does not use a textbook and relies only on lecture material, by far the worst econ teacher i've had!
Great professor!  Great sense of humor and really loves to teach.  The subject is a little boring but Spearot does a good job of keeping the class engaged.

at the beginning of the quarter i thought this guy was a horrible professor. but as the quarter continued he proved to be a pretty good lecturer. class is passable if you do your homework and study old exams. going to sections is also helpful for homework and other questions.

good lectures - tries hard to explain material. too many typos on his stuff tho- grades fairly on tests and hw. TAs were not that helpful during section but MSI helped alot. go to class and MSI and you should be fine. enjoyed class alot given the uninteresting material covered

SO. his tests are completley screwy, he gives you A LOT of material to go over and study with for midterms and the final however the actualy test he gives you will either be pretty similiar or completly not!Go to class, he doesnt put lectures online.  homeworks are barable. makes it as easy to listen to as it could be for such a borring subject.

Extremely good teacher. very interesting material. hes very nice. easy to talk to. he is very helpful and works really hard with his Ta and Msi just to make sure it benefits students. BEST ROOKIE TEACHER EVER
